data.name: Apache HTTP Server
data.footnote: NOTE: Only the latest update of 2.4.x version of the Red Hat JBoss Core Services HTTP server is maintained.

all_phases.name: Extended update support Term 2
all_phases.tooltip: The Extended Life Cycle Phase (ELP) is the post-retirement time period. We require that customers running Red Hat Enterprise Linux products beyond their retirement continue to have active subscriptions which ensures that they continue receiving access to all previously released content, documentation, and knowledge base articles as well as receive limited technical support. As there are no bug fixes, security fixes, hardware enablement, or root cause analysis available during the Extended Life Phase, customers may choose to purchase the Extended Life Cycle Support Add-On during the Extended Life Phase, which will provide them with critical impact security fixes and selected urgent priority bug fixes.

data.name: Migration Toolkit for Runtimes
data.footnote:
Note: Originally, MTR releases included a Maintenance support phase. Support phases for MTR releases now end when the next version is released.

Note: The Migration Toolkit for Runtimes product will reach its End of Life by September 30th, 2024. All customers using it should start their to transition to Migration Toolkit for Applications, as it is fully backwards compatible with all features and rulesets available in Migration Toolkit for Runtimes and will be maintained in the long term.

all_phases.tooltip: The Extended Life Cycle Phase (ELP) is the post-retirement time period. We require that customers running Red Hat Enterprise Linux products beyond their retirement continue to have active subscriptions which ensures that they continue receiving access to all previously released content, documentation, and knowledge base articles as well as receive limited technical support. data.footnote:
Starting with OpenJDK 8, multiple platforms are supported. Please see the "Detailed life cycle information" linked above for more details and a matrix of the platforms supported.

Support for OpenJDK and Eclipse Temurin is entitled via multiple Red Hat subscriptions. Please see the "Detailed life cycle information" linked above for more details.

As there are no bug fixes, security fixes, hardware enablement, or root cause analysis available during the Extended Life Phase, customers may choose to purchase the Extended Life Cycle Support Add-On during the Extended Life Phase, which will provide them with critical impact security fixes and selected urgent priority bug fixes.

NOTE: Entando App Manager Included. Entando App Manager follows a 3 year life cycle. Entando App Manager 5.x full support from May 2018 to May 2020. Maintenance support from May 2020 to May 2021

data.name: Red Hat Software Collections (RHEL 6 and RHEL 7)
Red Hat support for Spring Boot
data.footnote:
NOTE: Spring Boot support ends only after the Spring Community upstream version has reached End of Life. See specific dates above.

NOTE: Red Hat support for Spring Boot will come to the end of its life cycle with the end of Full Support for version 2.7.x. Going forward, support will be provided for the 3.x versions of the community releases of Spring Boot. Please see article: Tested and Verified Spring Boot 3 for Red Hat platforms for more details.
